column2650: I know that as well as you do, but I've got to dress up in peacock's feathers and pretend.
column2651: I'm no end of a swell for your sakes.
column2652: It's all bluff--it's the way business is done nowadays.
column2657: He proceeds with a threat in his voice._) Many a time I've been that worried over getting in the orders I've had half a mind to shut up shop.
column2658: Don't drive me too far or I'll do it.
column2660: There's enough working men walking the streets.
column2661: How _'_ud you fellows like to join 'em?
column2662: I know it's not an easy life.
column2663: (_Plaintively._) I'm doing my level best to make it easier.
column2664: Only to-day I've arranged with Dr. Clavering---- Clav.
column2668: To give him an appointment as medical officer to my works.
column2670: (_Clavering goes out c. quickly, closing the door._) John (_looking at Rosie appealingly_).
column2675: Don't let him be hard on me, my dear.
column2677: If only you will speak to him.
column2678: You can always have your way with your father.
column2679: (_He puts out his hands appealingly._) Rosie (_taking his hand in hers and patting it as if soothing a frightened child_).
column2681: Do you think I'd let you two old gentlemen quarrel about nothing?
column2682: Charlie's father and mine must always be good friends.
column2689: You're not going to marry him after what's happened.
column2693: But--I don't know anything--I thought he'd---- Rosie (_soothingly_).
column2695: I promise you father shan't be nasty to you.
column2696: John (_pressing her hand._) Bless you, my dear, bless you.
column2697: You don't know what that means to me.
column2699: The murmur of great applause comes from c. Rosie looks off c. expectantly.
column2700: The door opens and the sound increases.
column2701: Enter Jabez visibly glowing with heat and triumph, Clavering all smiles, and a little behind Charlie, very much dejected.
column2702: The door remains open and the sound dies down gradually._) Jabez.
column2707: You'd done the trick before I opened my mouth, sir.
column2708: (_Charlie goes to the back with the evident intention of effacing himself._) Jabez (_briskly_).
